fr:mainmatter.html:p: Stillvaro is designed to work privately on your device.

html:ul.html:li: Stillvaro does not require an account.
Stillvaro does not collect personal information.
Stillvaro does not collect contact information, location data, or identifiers.
Stillvaro does not use analytics SDKs, advertising SDKs, or tracking technologies.

html:p.html:strong: What data is stored on device

html:ul.html:li: App settings (for example: Guidance Mode, haptics preference, launch behavior, and block preferences).
Session state needed to resume progress (for example: current block, completed count, and local heat field/session summary state).
All stored data is used only to provide app functionality on your device.
Data is not sold, shared, or used for cross-app tracking.

fr:mainmatter.html:p: Stillvaro does not share data with third parties.

Stillvaro can utilize Apple's App Analytics to understand the app's engagement and usage. Data is provided if you have opted-in to share analytics, diagnostics, and usage information with App Developers in your device's settings. Apple collects this information anonymously. You can opt-in (or out) by following the instructions: https://support.apple.com/HT202100

html:ul.html:li: Session and settings data remain on your device until changed or removed.
You can reset your session from inside the app.
You can remove all app data by deleting the app from your device.

html:ol.html:li: Start with the current 4-digit block shown above the ring.
Tap or drag to and hold the matching digits on the ring in order.
Complete the block and continue to the next one.

html:ul.html:li: Keep going calmly.
The app gradually reduces digit options to hint the next after a miss.
Use Guidance Mode if you want constant next-digit highlighting.

html:ol.html:li: Under Up Next, choose Next Block.
Pick a block number and tap Done.
Under Session Start, set Resume from last position on launch on or off.
Set Starting Position for manual reset and launch when resume is off.
Open the Reference Peek panel from the main screen or swipe left to right.

html:ul.html:li: Enable Larger Text in iOS Accessibility settings if desired.
Enable Reduce Motion to suppress motion-heavy interactions.
Enable Increased Contrast or Differentiate Without Color for stronger visual cues.
Use VoiceOver for spoken labels and state hints. (feedback welcome)
